message.body: $TSLA In case anyone missed it. They literally cannot manufacture Model 3's fast enough to satisfy demand. https://www.autoblog.com/2018/06/06/tesla-model-3-best-selling-midsize-premium-sedan/

links.title: Tesla says Model 3 is best-selling midsize premium sedan in America
links.description: Auto sales figures are sort of fuzzy numbers, no matter how you slice them and no matter which manufacturer you're talking about. Unless you're specifically tracking vehicle registrations, automakers generally self-report the figures. So, you have to trust that they aren't doing anything too tricky.

messages.body: $TSLA Millennials are smart. They know the tech is garbage & they don’t want to hold the next debt bubble. https://finance.yahoo.com/news/millennials-ditching-tesla-shares-faster-162400597.html

links.title: Millennials are ditching Tesla shares faster than any other company (TSLA)
links.description: More than 5,000 investors on Robinhood ditched Tesla this week. The sell-off mirrors a decline in the stock's price in recent months. Tesla is up 10% this week following the company's annual shareholder meeting. Until this week, Tesla's stock had hit a rough patch.

links.title: Investing in Solar Energy : SunPower SPWR
links.description: SunPower Corporation (NASDAQ:SPWR) is the biggest commercial solar company in the U.S. The energy company designs manufactures and delivers high-performance solar electric systems worldwide for residential commercial and utility-scale power plant customers. Its high-efficiency solar modules and a commercial solution called Helix makes solar projects turnkey for installers, helping businesses, schools, and municipalities across the country save money by going solar.

source.name: Elliott Wave Forecast : Analysis and Trading Signals

links.title: Daimler unveils electric eCascadia semi truck to compete with Tesla Semi, launches electric truck group
links.description: Daimler, one of the world's largest truck maker, has been feeling the pressure from Tesla's electric truck - going as far as saying that they have "passed them by" if the claims Tesla is making about its electric semi truck are true.
